revised_title: The Trypanosome Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland: Development in Glossina Morsitans
tldr: This study investigates the development of the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland in the tsetse fly species Glossina morsitans. The researchers found that the average time required for the cycle of development of the trypanosome in G. morsitans is around 24 days, with 11 experiments conducted using laboratory-bred flies and 5 experiments using wild flies.
